Show HN: Merry Sky, Dark Sky replacement and merry-timeline open source lib
text:
Hello HN,

This is a website I worked on during the holidays to fill the void of the upcoming dark sky shutdown. For me, the precipitation timeline was a view I was heavily relying on for everyday activities and planning. I had not found any replacement from the various weather apps. When I found pirateweather.net as a backend API, it gave me the motivation to put the pieces together and get back the experience I enjoyed. I then added more functionalities that I think was missing from the website such as a weekly chart view. I've been using the website reliably over christmas holidays. Hope you enjoy it too!

Also I open sourced the visual component for drawing the precipitation timeline and you can use it for drawing weather information or any other hourly activities really https://github.com/guillaume/merry-timeline

Interested in your feedback!

Ask HN: How do you get into the right headspace to think deeply?
text:
it's like I need to hit some sort of trifecta to be able to do it these days: slept really well, no ongoing issue, nothing sad happened recently, something insightful was noticed, free time....etc.

I remember around age 10-16 this was my default state, I could think about things so deeply anytime anywhere, to point I'd be looking at someone not even know.. or just looking at clouds and get lost deep into thoughts and have epiphany half an hour later....

I admit age wasn't the only thing different between then and now, I hadn't discovered reddit, didn't use youtube much, only played video games around 8pm for 2 hours, had very consistent schedule, had far fewer responsibilities, and things always looked up and up in sense there was lot of hope and potential, future seemed brighter. I guess reflecting back I can see my mind was much more free of distractions. (social media, news, entertainment, etc) :/

Ask HN: Anyone else having a hard time following sports events?
text:
Hey all I have come to realize that there are no good all-in-one applications to notify me of sports events that I like to follow! Till now I had been either manually adding matches to google calendar with notifications (not to mention that for the matches that were usually at night, I had to setup separate day notifications for them) or pretty much downloading separate apps to follow when events related to that sport were about to happen. I have come to a conclusion that there might be some scope for development here and want to validate if anybody else would be interested in an application to solve something like this? Basically, I have been thinking about working on a mobile app where you choose your favourite sport at setup time (can further narrow down to maybe teams if need be) and it would notify you when a game related to that sport is going to come up. It would also keep track of your timezone, so when the game is at night in your local time, it would notify you a couple hours earlier, just so you can attend it if you want to. All that said, do you thinks it a worthwhile problem to solve? If yes, would you be interested in paying for it? Any and all feedback is welcome.

Note: It's probably not the biggest problem to deal with but personally, having an application like that will probably save me a couple of hours every now and then XD.

title: Ask HN: Has anyone tried to rewrite a law in Prolog?
text:
Curious if it is possible and if it makes sense to define everything in a law or constitutional act as logical rules using a logic-based programming language such as Prolog.

It'd be really fun to simply type a logical question and directly see whether it is legal or illegal based on all the definitions.

title: Unearthing the Original Mediterranean Diet
Looking for Advice on Selling Content Platform/SaaS App Startup (~$50K MRR)
text:
My co-founder and I have been running our business for a little for a year and a half, and we're interested in selling our business to allow us to shift into different business models. Some information on the business:

- We've been operational for around 20 months.

- Our business is automated and requires minimal involvement from the co-founder and I (with the exception of sales, which we still do),

- Our margins are usually between 45-50%, and sometimes significantly more. We've had pretty consistent growth month over month. Around 15-20% on average.

Questions:

- How would you go about selling a business like this?

- We're familiar with marketplaces like Flippa and MicroAcquire for selling businesses. Are there any negatives to listing on platforms like these?

- Is it common practice to reach out to competitors to see if they're interested in acquiring your business?

- How much are businesses like ours usually valued at?

(after looking on the aforementioned websites, and speaking with a few people, the conclusion seems to be that our multiple is somewhere between an agency (1-2x rev) & a high-touch SaaS app (3-5x rev). But I understand markets are changing now, too, and startups are more often valued on earnings. how much should we be asking for?)

Thanks!
